medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mrs. C was first found to have protein in her urine at age 20. She has had renal insufficiency for 23 years. Symptoms have included fatigue, which improved with epoetin alfa, but otherwise no significant symptoms are noted. Her nephrologist indicated she will soon require renal replacement therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic renal insufficiency for 23 years, diagnosed as focal segmental glomerular sclerosis following a kidney biopsy in 1995. Past medical history includes elevated cholesterol levels.
medical_history.social_history: Works as a part-time nurse assistant, lives with husband and son, smokes less than 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years (trying to cut down), and drinks alcohol rarely.
